name: Hotel du Vin & Bistro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i recently stayed a night with my partner and the night was perfect from start to finish
reviews.title: special night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in the mouton rothschild room, the room was huge with the double bed taking centre piece ,
reviews.title: Veuve Cliqcout absolutely Divine Du vin!
Paper thin walls...
reviews.text: the bathroom was also huge, with an old iron bath and a large show,, all fittings were to a high standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room in a whole was worth the money ,
reviews.title: hotel du excellent!

reviews.text: we also had dinner in the hotel , the service and food was perfect , we ended the night in the hotel bar in a relaxed atmosphere
reviews.title: COCKTAIL AFTERNOON TEA!
Take earplugs!
reviews.text: Like another recent reviewer, we suffered greatly due to the constant noise from plumbing and air-conditioning. Another source of noise was a fire-door in the 1st floor corridor that slammed so vigorously every time it was used that the wardrobe doors in our room rattled and shook. Such a shame, as this hotel has so much to offer: good location for old town; nicely presented rooms; great little bar and whisky snug; really good bistro - we dined and had breakfast and all the food was freshly prepared and uniformly excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly, this can't all make up for a lost night's sleep, and when the little darlings in the room above decided to start jumping off their bed at 6:10am then that was us fully awake... We did stay here once before and suffered similarly with plumbing and air-con but had hoped that was a one-off. Obviously not, so we will go elsewhere in future I'm afraid.
reviews.title: Good hotel, superb bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night last Saturday for my anniversary in a 'superior' room ( basically a double room with a bath tub in the room also).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, couldn't have asked for more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is pretty cool, I live in Edinburgh and have always walked past the outside thinking nothing of it but the place is a lot larger than it looks. The courtyard is nice, and the entrance is cool, a bit generic though.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, shame about the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had everything you'd expect for the price(179), nothing more, nothing less.
reviews.title: friendly staff

reviews.text: Stayed for one night in a nice comfortable room. The hotel used to be an old asylum, so it is a mixture of the old and new. Great central location for sight seeing. Breakfast was great and there was a good selection. Service was prompt and friendly.
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 1 night at the Hotel Du vin with our 11 week old daughter. From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't have been more helpful. They were fantastic and checked us in quickly and also provided advice on how to get to the main shops and sights. The location was quite central within walking distance to the shops and the restaurants and bars on the royal mile.
reviews.title: Fantastic freindly hotel

reviews.text: The room was great as we were also upgraded on arrival to a suite. We were also provided with a top of the range travel cot for the baby.
reviews.title: Does not live up to expectations...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner in the hotel bistro and the food was amazing, as usual at the hotel du vin and the service was friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Fabulous overnight stay

reviews.text: Overall this was a fantastic experience and we will definitely be back when we return to Edinburgh I would recommend this hotel to anybody.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location, fantastic staff and service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location to walk around Edinburgh and in a nice area for restaurants and shops. Compared to other HDV I wouldn't say it was the most attractive from the outside and the court yard as well as the standard room which was basic, but comfortable.
reviews.title: Good choice for exploring Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great evening in the bar and restaurant. The ambience and decor were fantastic. We were lucky to sit near the big open fire.
reviews.title: A pleasant hotel with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had a good experience with good service, but it is not as impressive as other HDV's
reviews.title: Best night in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights Thursday - Saturday. Our room was ready when we came to check in about an hour early. The reception staff were very helpful and offered advice and a map of the local area. The room was clean, well maintained and nicely decorated. We had asked for a quiet room as we had seen previous comments regarding noise in some of the rooms. Were were given Chapel Down room. This room was above the court yard and directly above the cigar Boffie which did lead to some very minor noise but not enough to disturb our stay.It does suffer from noisey pipes during the night but again not enough to ruin the stay.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was reasonable on both days although not the best we have had from a hotel of this standard. On the first day our table was not cleared down after our cooked breakfast and led us to having to stack the plates on the corner of the table. Not a major problem though.
reviews.title: excellent

description: Hotel du Vin Edinburgh is nestled deep in Edinburgh's Old Town and only a short walk from the historic Royal Mile.A relaxing haven, the hotel offers a trademark Hotel du Vin Bistro, mezzanine bar, private dining, whisky snug and specialist Laroche wine-tasting room.
